memberdef.definition: final Map<String, MessageChannel<T> > desmoj.extensions.crossbar.MessageCrossbar< T extends SimProcess >.messageChannelsByName
memberdef.name: messageChannelsByName

detaileddescription.para: The map in which the MessageCrossbar stores all its individual MessageChannels

memberdef.definition: final Map<T, CrossbarMessage> desmoj.extensions.crossbar.MessageCrossbar< T extends SimProcess >.messagesByProcesses
memberdef.name: messagesByProcesses

detaileddescription.para: A map matching sent messages to their receivers.
A queue containing all process currently waiting on the MessageCrossbar.
A counter keeping track of the processes which were interrupted and removed from this channel because of their max waiting time on the MessageCrossbar was reached.
A counter keeping track of the messages which were successfully delivered to a waiting process. A message is considered delivered if it was forwarded to at least one waiting process.

A counter keeping track of the messages which could not be delivered to a waiting process. A message is considered lost if it could not be forwarded to any receiver because at the time it was received there was no process waiting for messages.

memberdef.argsstring: (Model owner, String name, boolean showInReport, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: MessageCrossbar

detaileddescription.para: Creates a MessageCrossbar object with all parameters required. The MessageCrossbar registers itself at the given model

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : The name of this reportable
Model : The model this reportable is associated to
boolean : Flag for showing the report Set it to true if reportable should show up in report. Set it to false if reportable should not be shown in report.
boolean : Flag for showing this reportable in trace files. Set it to true if reportable should show up in trace. Set it to false if reportable should not be shown in trace.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new MessageChannel with is automatically associated with the MessageCrossbar. If a channel with the specified name already exists it will be returned instead of a new channel.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the new channel

simplesect.para: The number of delivered messages. A message is considered delivered if it was forwarded to at least one waiting process.
The number of process which were interrupted while waiting on the MessageCrossbar because their max wait time was exceeded.
The number of message which were sent to this MessageCrossbar but couldn't be forwarded to a receiver because no process was waiting on the MessageCrossbar at the time the message was received.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the MessageChannel identified by the given name.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the channel

simplesect.para: The MessageChannel identified by the given name, or null if no channel with that name is managed by the MessageCrossbar.
The number of processes which have been handled by this message MessageCrossbar (meaning processes which entered the channel and also left it again).
The number of process that were successfully activated by a delivered message.
The number of messages which were sent to this channel.

detaileddescription.para: Sends the given CrossbarMessage to the specified message channels, thereby activating all processes that are waiting on these channel.

parameterdescription.para: The message to send to the specified channels
The channels to which the message will be sent

detaileddescription.para: Wait for a CrossbarMessage on the specified message channels, thereby passivating the current process. The process is not reactivated until a message is received.

parameterdescription.para: The channels on which to wait for a message

detaileddescription.para: Wait for a CrossbarMessage on the specified message channels, thereby passivating the current process. The process is not reactivated until a message is received. The parameter waitUntil specifies the point in time to which the current process will wait for a message. If no message is received before that time, the process will be interrupted and a DelayedInterruptException will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: The channels on which to wait for a message
The point in time at which the waiting will be interrupted
An exception indicating that the point in time specified by the waitUntil parameter has passed and the waiting has been interrupted.

detaileddescription.para: Wait for a CrossbarMessage on the specified message channels, thereby passivating the current process. The process is not reactivated until a message is received. The parameter maxWaitTime specifies maximum time the current process will wait for a message. If no message is received before this amount of time has elapsed, the process will be interrupted and a DelayedInterruptException will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: The channels on which to wait for a message
The maximum amount of time until the waiting will be interrupted
An exception indicating that the maximum wait time specified by the maxWaitTime parameter has passed and that the waiting has been interrupted

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether the SimProcess (in it's current state) can wait at the message crossbar.

simplesect.para: Whether the SimProcess is valid or not.

parameterdescription.para: The SimProcess to check
The Method from which this method is called

detaileddescription.para: Method that returns the message which is to be distributed to the receiver. This can either be the original message itself if the DistributionMode of the message is DistributionMode#DISTRIBUTE_BY_REFERENCE or a copy if the DistributionMode is DistributionMode#DISTRIBUTE_AS_COPY

parameterdescription.para: The original message

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether the given list of message channels is valid.

parameterdescription.para: The list of channels to check
The caller method

simplesect.para: True if the list of channels is valid, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether the given CrossbarMessage is valid.

parameterdescription.para: The message to check
The caller method

simplesect.para: True if the message is valid, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether the SimProcess using the MessageCrossbar is a valid process.

simplesect.para: Whether the SimProcess can currently wait at the crossbar.

parameterdescription.para: The SimProcess to check
The Method from which this method is called

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether the given TimeInstant is valid

parameterdescription.para: The TimeInstant to check
The caller method

simplesect.para: True if the TimeInstant is valid, false otherwise

memberdef.type: public< ST extends T > MessageChannel< ST >
memberdef.definition: public<ST extends T> MessageChannel<ST> desmoj.extensions.crossbar.MessageCrossbar< T extends SimProcess >.createMessageChannel
memberdef.argsstring: (String channelName, Class< ST > desiredGenericType, boolean showInReport, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: createMessageChannel

detaileddescription.para:
Creates a new MessageChannel with is automatically associated with the MessageCrossbar. If a channel with the specified name already exists it will be returned instead of a new channel.
By specifying the generic type of the MessageChannel this method allows the creation of MessageChannels which are more specifically typed than the MessageCrossbar. In this way on a generally typed MessageCrossbar< SimProcess> a MessageChannel< Truck> (where Truck extends SimProcess) can be created.

parameterdescription.para: String : The name of the new channel
Class<ST> : The generic typ of the channel.
boolean : Flag for showing the report Set it to true if reportable should show up in report. Set it to false if reportable should not be shown in report.
boolean : Flag for showing this reportable in trace files. Set it to true if reportable should show up in trace. Set it to false if reportable should not be shown in trace.

simplesect.para: The Queue in which all passivated processes are stored.

detaileddescription.para:
The MessageCrossbar is a higher modeling construct used to synchronize processes.
The MessageCrossbare permits the creation of any number of MessageChannels on it. Over these channels messages can be sent from one sender process to any number of receiver processes. To receive a message a process has to wait for it on a message channel. Once a process starts waiting on a channel it is automatically passivated and blocked. If a process sends a message to a channel all process waiting there will be reactivated and unregistered from the message channel and the MessageCrossbar.
It is possible for a process to wait on several message channels simultaneously. It will be activated and removed from all channels if a message is received on any of those channels. In parallel it is also possible for a process to send messages to several channels simultaneously.

MessageChannel
CrossbarMessage
